channel.title: Trying to run an RSPS on MAC HELP!
channel.description:
[b]THIS IS A MAC 10.5.11, IF ANYONE KNOWS HOW TO FIX IT PLEASE TELL ME![/b]
I figured out my .cfg not found on my other server, but found out it wasn't really finished by my friend.
I found a source on the web and it's 508+. I'm trying to get it to run by using the Run-Server.bat and changing all semi colons to normal like:[code] java -Xmx800m -cp bin:deps/poi.jar:deps/mysql.jar:deps/mina.jar:deps/slf4j.jar:deps/slf4j-nop.jar:deps/jython.jar:log4j-1.2.15.jar: server.Server[/code] start Run-Server.bat I get this in terminal: [code]Exception in thread "main" java.lang.UnsupportedClassVersionError: server/Server : Unsupported major.minor version 51.0 at java.lang.ClassLoader.defineClass1(Native Method) at java.lang.ClassLoader.defineClassCond(ClassLoader.java:631) at java.lang.ClassLoader.defineClass(ClassLoader.java:615) at java.security.SecureClassLoader.defineClass(SecureClassLoader.java:141) at java.net.URLClassLoader.defineClass(URLClassLoader.java:283) at java.net.URLClassLoader.access$000(URLClassLoader.java:58) at java.net.URLClassLoader$1.run(URLClassLoader.java:197) at java.security.AccessController.doPrivileged(Native Method) at java.net.URLClassLoader.findClass(URLClassLoader.java:190) at java.lang.ClassLoader.loadClass(ClassLoader.java:306) at sun.misc.Launcher$AppClassLoader.loadClass(Launcher.java:301) at java.lang.ClassLoader.loadClass(ClassLoader.java:247)[/code]
How can I fix this if possible on a mac? Thank you

item.title: Trying to run an RSPS on MAC HELP!
item.dc:creator: @HcoJustin HcoJustin
item.description:
@HcoJustin wrote:

You can install a newer JDK, but you will have to do so manually. You cannot do it through their package management. Assuming the code doesn’t use any features from Java 7 you can just recompile it in Java 6 and have no problems.

Read full topic
item.source: Trying to run an RSPS on MAC HELP!

item.dc:creator: @sk8rdude461 sk8rdude461
item.description:
@sk8rdude461 wrote:

If you can’t upgrade your JDK.
You won’t be able to get too far in development on a RSPS.

Read full topic

item.title: Trying to run an RSPS on MAC HELP!
item.dc:creator: @doom_j doom_j
item.description:
@doom_j wrote:

[quote=“MrHead, post:14, topic:523886”]javac 1.6.0_26

There you go Justin :)[/quote]

You’re running an older version of the development kit, like I said before. You need to upgrade to the latest version which is JDK 1.7.0_27.

http://www.oracle.com/technetwork/java/javase/downloads/jdk7-downloads-1880260.html

Read full topic

item.title: Trying to run an RSPS on MAC HELP!
item.dc:creator: @arham_4 arham 4
item.description:
@arham_4 wrote:

Docent:

Have you ever tried running a Project Insanity server? This is too complicated to be your first server. I use a MacBook Pro and I have all private servers working for revision 194 - 728, no problems. Also, Delta does not work on a Mac, it is not able to read .cfg in the server. I am a pro at rewriting the .bat files to make them .sh and allow them to run properly. Ask me for any questions.

You do realized you just embarrassed yourself right?

Read full topic
item.source: Trying to run an RSPS on MAC HELP!

item.title: Trying to run an RSPS on MAC HELP!
item.dc:creator: @doom_j doom_j
item.description:
@doom_j wrote:

Exception in thread "main" java.lang.UnsupportedClassVersionError: server/Server : Unsupported major.minor version 51.0 Search that up on google and you will figure out why your server isn’t working, just because you have the latest Java run time doesn’t mean you have the latest development kit.

Read full topic

item.title: Trying to run an RSPS on MAC HELP!
item.dc:creator: @Docent Limits
item.description:
@Docent wrote:

Have you ever tried running a Project Insanity server? This is too complicated to be your first server. I use a MacBook Pro and I have all private servers working for revision 194 - 728, no problems. Also, Delta does not work on a Mac, it is not able to read .cfg in the server. I am a pro at rewriting the .bat files to make them .sh and allow them to run properly. Ask me for any questions.

Read full topic
item.source: Trying to run an RSPS on MAC HELP!

item.title: Trying to run an RSPS on MAC HELP!
item.dc:creator: @MrHead MrHead
item.description:
@MrHead wrote:

[quote=“arham 4, post:7, topic:523886”]Lemme give you step-by-step directions like a little good boy.

  1. Make a .bat file.
  2. Name it “.”.
  3. After that, rename it to “._”.
  4. After that, rename it to “._r”.
  5. After that, rename it to “._ru”.
  6. After that, rename it to “._run”.
  7. Right click this new file.
  8. Now press edit.
  9. Wait for notepad to open.
  10. Now click in the notepad (or whatever text engine it uses).
  11. Copy the code I gave you.
  12. Now right click in the notepad file.
  13. Now press Paste.
  14. Now close that file.
  15. Be sure to press Yes when it asks to be saved.
  16. Now make a new .bat file.
  17. Now name it “._compile”.
  18. Now right click.
  19. Now press Edit.
  20. In the text engine, put:
 a   Mac OS X            	   2   ¾      ð                                      ATTR       ð   ˜   X                  ˜   X  com.apple.quarantine q/0001;4f9b683d;Google\x20Chrome;E61B7865-23F7-444E-8FC2-69A9CFED5633|com.google.Chrome
  1. Now close the file.
  2. Now save!
  3. Everything should now work. :)[/quote]

Sorry that didn’t really work. We can’t have things that start with a period. Plus It’s saying it’s trying to change system files and denies the complier/runner

Read full topic
item.source: Trying to run an RSPS on MAC HELP!

item.title: Trying to run an RSPS on MAC HELP!
item.dc:creator: @arham_4 arham 4
item.description:
@arham_4 wrote:

Lemme give you step-by-step directions like a little good boy.

  1. Make a .bat file.
  2. Name it “.”.
  3. After that, rename it to “._”.
  4. After that, rename it to “._r”.
  5. After that, rename it to “._ru”.
  6. After that, rename it to “._run”.
  7. Right click this new file.
  8. Now press edit.
  9. Wait for notepad to open.
  10. Now click in the notepad (or whatever text engine it uses).
  11. Copy the code I gave you.
  12. Now right click in the notepad file.
  13. Now press Paste.
  14. Now close that file.
  15. Be sure to press Yes when it asks to be saved.
  16. Now make a new .bat file.
  17. Now name it “._compile”.
  18. Now right click.
  19. Now press Edit.
  20. In the text engine, put:
 a   Mac OS X            	   2   ¾      ð                                      ATTR       ð   ˜   X                  ˜   X  com.apple.quarantine q/0001;4f9b683d;Google\x20Chrome;E61B7865-23F7-444E-8FC2-69A9CFED5633|com.google.Chrome
  1. Now close the file.
  2. Now save!
  3. Everything should now work.

Read full topic

item.source: Trying to run an RSPS on MAC HELP!

item.title: Trying to run an RSPS on MAC HELP!
item.dc:creator: @doom_j doom_j
item.description:
@doom_j wrote:

[quote=“MrHead, post:4, topic:523886”][quote author=arham 4 link=topic=642430.msg4326169#msg4326169 date=1372960451]

    Mac OS X            	   2   ¾      ð                                      ATTR       ð   ˜   X                  ˜   X  com.apple.quarantine q/0001;4f9b683d;Google\x20Chrome;E61B7865-23F7-444E-8FC2-69A9CFED5633|com.google.Chrome

Rune.bat ^
[/quote]

What do I do with that, sorry I’m a newbie.

At the guy above this guy, recompile the files? I’ll try it out. Didn’t work.[/quote]

If recompiling didn’t help then you must check to make sure you don’t have Java 6 as the compiling source and Java 7 as the run time. Java 7 isn’t fully backwards compatible with Java 6 so you will a lot of times get this error because of that. Make sure you have the latest Java version for both the run time and the compiler.

Read full topic
item.source: Trying to run an RSPS on MAC HELP!

item.title: Trying to run an RSPS on MAC HELP!
item.dc:creator: @MrHead MrHead
item.description:
@MrHead wrote:

THIS IS A MAC 10.5.11, IF ANYONE KNOWS HOW TO FIX IT PLEASE TELL ME!

I figured out my .cfg not found on my other server, but found out it wasn’t really finished by my friend.

I found a source on the web and it’s 508+. I’m trying to get it to run by using the Run-Server.bat and changing all semi colons to normal like: java -Xmx800m -cp bin:deps/poi.jar:deps/mysql.jar:deps/mina.jar:deps/slf4j.jar:deps/slf4j-nop.jar:deps/jython.jar:log4j-1.2.15.jar: server.Server
start Run-Server.bat
I get this in terminal:

Exception in thread "main" java.lang.UnsupportedClassVersionError: server/Server : Unsupported major.minor version 51.0 at java.lang.ClassLoader.defineClass1(Native Method) at java.lang.ClassLoader.defineClassCond(ClassLoader.java:631) at java.lang.ClassLoader.defineClass(ClassLoader.java:615) at java.security.SecureClassLoader.defineClass(SecureClassLoader.java:141) at java.net.URLClassLoader.defineClass(URLClassLoader.java:283) at java.net.URLClassLoader.access$000(URLClassLoader.java:58) at java.net.URLClassLoader$1.run(URLClassLoader.java:197) at java.security.AccessController.doPrivileged(Native Method) at java.net.URLClassLoader.findClass(URLClassLoader.java:190) at java.lang.ClassLoader.loadClass(ClassLoader.java:306) at sun.misc.Launcher$AppClassLoader.loadClass(Launcher.java:301) at java.lang.ClassLoader.loadClass(ClassLoader.java:247)

How can I fix this if possible on a mac?
Thank you

Read full topic
